data.title: Quiet Speculation
data.meta_description: My name is Gervaise Pechler, a 22 year old Business & Psychology student, avid trader & I love playing Magic. I like to combine Psychological, Business & Economical aspects in my writings
data.text:
Gervaise muses about what lessons Magic speculators can learn from real-life experiences.

Gervaise recounts his experiences from the floor at Pro Tour Theros in Dublin.

Gervaise has compiled an exhaustive study of the path many of RtRâ€™s chase singles have taken over the past three months, focusing much of his attention on the little Elf Shaman who could.

Take a look at your role as a trader in the Magic card market from 10,000 feet. Today, Gervaise shows how having a better understanding of your role will lead to better long-term profits.

Gervaise is here this week to show you how being nice can also yield nice profits.

Gervaise examines how we think as Magic traders and offers insight on how to continually improve.

Gervaise shares some insights derived from the finance and poker worlds.

Gervaise addresses a variety of topics on trading and speculation, including his stance on Return to Ravnica preorders and some notable trades.

Gervaise delves into the techniques and reasons behind using the internet as a primary mode of card acquisition.

In his first article, Gervaise details the elements that distinguish the European market from the American market and overviews some helpful fundamentals.
